title: Trial Without Judge
outcome: Amid BCI absence and public anxiety, citizens hold open assemblies to judge former Council figures, including Lintz and Kova. Forgotten truths around BCI erasures resurface, culminating in a 'ghost' revealing the reasons behind their disappearance—shifting the city’s understanding of justice. The episode ends with citywide debate about restoring centralized power versus keeping local justice.

events.description: Neighborhood assemblies gather, judging disputes and calling on Council members to answer for past abuses while BCI remains offline.
Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova are brought before citizen-led tribunals, facing accusations about manipulation and failures tied to BCI erasures and restorations.
A prominent 'ghost' testifies, revealing their original disappearance was due to uncovering systemic bias in the BCI, not actual wrongdoing.
Public debate fractures: some demand centralized authority for stability, others champion evolving local assemblies and justice by consensus.
